pages.text: The $(thing)Steam Generator$() is the heart of your electrical network. When placed above a heat source, it consumes water and produces $(thing)Electricity$().$(br2)Water can either be brought in with buckets using the input slot, or piped in from another source.
The higher the temperature, the faster the $(thing)Steam Generator$() consumes water and produces electricity.

It is important to make sure you have enough $(thing)FE storage$() to capitalize on the entirety of your fuel's burn time.$(br2)The thermometer in the interface is different than heat producing sources as it shows the temperature up to its highest functioning value.$(br2)To toggle automatic power output, press the $(thing)Auto$() button.
